name: NYC Bagels
instructions: Combine water, sugar and yeast together
Combine Flour & Salt and then add stirred liquid to combine
Knead dough for about 10 minutes until stiff
Rise dough for about 1 1/2 hours
Cut dough into equal sizes (8 large/12 small), roll into a dough ball
Cover dough with plastic wrap and proof for 30 min
Punch hole in middle and shape as bagel
In slowly boiling water add bagels - 2 minutes one side and then 1 to 2 minutes second side
Bake at 425 F for 20-25 min, turning after about 15 min

name: Artisan Crackers
instructions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees. Combine the flour, salt, honey, and olive oil by hand
Add the water and shape into a ball. Let the dough rest for about 30 minutes.
1 tsp Salt
add rosemary or pepper, then roll out each individual piece of dough as thin as you possibly can. Brush top with olive oil and sprinkle salt as desired. Cut into strips or desired shape

Bake for 4-6 minutes, but check periodically to make sure it’s not getting too brown – flip each cracker piece and bake another 4-6 minutes. Once they are the color you like take them out and turn off oven. After 30 min put back into now warm oven and leave for a few hours to allow them to fully dry out if you prefer

name: Fig Jam
instructions: For a thick jam simmer for 50 to 60 minutes. For a looser jam simmer for 40 minutes
Place lemon rind OR juice of lemon and all other ingredients into a medium, heavy bottomed saucepan. Stir to combine.
Bring contents to a boil over medium high heat, stirring frequently. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 40 to 60 minutes.
Discard thym stems and lemon peel. Pulse jam with an immersion blender to chop up the fig skins if desired.

name: Overnight Bread
instructions: Heat over to 475 with cast iron in the oven
Shape dough and then proof for up to 30 min while oven is heating
Bake 30 minutes with the lid on (or foil) and then 25-30 min with the lid off

name: Overnight Bread Weights
instructions: Heat over to 475 with cast iron in the oven
Shape dough and then proof for up to 30 min while oven is heating
Bake 30 minutes with the lid on (or foil) and then 25-30 min with the lid off

name: Cinnamon Rolls
instructions: Oven 430 F. Mix dry ingredients and then add room temperature Butter, mix with a fork. Add Buttermilk and mix.
Roll out the dough into rectangle
Spread room temperature Butter onto dough. Mix Brown Sugar and Cinnamon and then press into sugar until it becomes moist.
Roll up and cut into 12 rolls. Line a baking tin and place rolls evenly in pan. Brush tops with Buttermilk
Bake 15-20 minutes until golden brown
Frosting - Mix/whip Cream Chesse & Butter, then add Sugar and Vanilla. Spread over rolls as soon as they come out of the oven

name: Cinnamon Roll Frosting
instructions: Frosting - Mix/whip Cream Cheese & Butter, then add Sugar and Vanilla. Spread over rolls as soon as they come out of the oven

name: Molten Chocolate Cakes
instructions: Spray 1/2 cup molds, 5 of them, with cooking spray and dust with sugar
Use a double boiler to melt Butter and Chocolate together and remove from heat. For 1oz chocolate can use 1tbsp cocoa+ 2 tsp sugar + 2 tsp butter or oil
In a separate bowl beat together Eggs, Egg yolks, and sugar and whisk until sugar is dissolved
Slowly beat the Chocolate mixture into the egg mixture, whisking constantly to prevent curdling. Then beat the Flour into the mixture until you can no longer see it.
Pour chocolate into molds and bake for 8 minutes at 425F. You want the outside to be set however the inside to be soft and runny.
description: small and easy to make molten chocolate cake
comments: learned this from cooking class at Macy's for Adobe NYC meetings March 2022
creator: Micol Negrin Rustico Cooking

name: Hot Cocoa
instructions: Add 3 tablespoons of the Hot Chocolate mix to 8 oz milk or water into a saucepan and stir. Simmer on medium/low heat for 2 minutes.

name: Hot Cross Buns
instructions: Bring 300ml full-fat milk to the boil, then remove from the heat and add 50g butter. Leave to cool until it reaches hand temperature. Put 500g strong bread flour, 1 tsp salt, 75g caster sugar and 7g sachet fast-action or easy-blend yeast into a bowl. Make a well in the centre. Pour in the warm milk and butter mixture, then add 1 beaten egg. Using a wooden spoon, mix well, then bring everything together with your hands until you have a sticky dough.

Tip on to a lightly floured surface and knead by holding the dough with one hand and stretching it with the heal of the other hand, then folding it back on itself. Repeat for 5 mins until smooth and elastic. Put the dough in a lightly oiled bowl. Cover with oiled cling film and leave to rise in a warm place for 1 hr or until doubled in size and a finger pressed into it leaves a dent.

With the dough still in the bowl, tip in 75g sultanas, 50g mixed peel, zest of 1 orange, 1 finely chopped apple and 1 tsp ground cinnamon. Knead into the dough, making sure everything is well distributed. Leave to rise for 1 hr more, or until doubled in size, again covered by some well-oiled cling film to stop the dough getting a crust.

Divide the dough into 15 even pieces (about 75g per piece). Roll each piece into a smooth ball on a lightly floured work surface. Arrange the buns on one or two baking trays lined with parchment, leaving enough space for the dough to expand. Cover (but don’t wrap) with more oiled cling film, or a clean tea towel, then set aside to prove for 1 hr more.

Heat oven to 428F. Mix 75g plain flour with about 5 tbsp water to make the paste for the cross – add the water 1 tbsp at a time, so you add just enough for a thick paste. Spoon into a piping bag with a small nozzle. Pipe a line along each row of buns, then repeat in the other direction to create crosses. Bake for 20 mins on the middle shelf of the oven, until golden brown.
comments: best recipe for hot cross buns
creator: Mud brick Winery Waiheke

name: Caramel or Peanut Butter Brownie
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 F
Grease and line baking tin
Melt butter and cocoa and then add brown sugar to it
Add eggs and beat them one at a time, then mix in the flour
Put into the baking tin
Bake for 30 minutes
comments: delicious and best with peanut butter cups

name: Suzie's Plum Sauce
instructions: Slice plums in 1/2, remove stone. Roughly chop the onion and garlic.
Combine all ingredients in a large pot and bring to a boil, stirring regularly
Lower heat to a simmer and reduce until sauce consistency

name: Homemade British Mixed Spice
instructions: Combine all spices together and it will make about 1/4 c in total

name: Classic Pesto
instructions: Using a food processor combine Basil, Garlic and Nuts
Add Cheeses and Salt and combine
Slowly add olive oil until mixed through
comments: can swap out pine nuts for pistachios or walnuts. Recipe makes about 1 cup

name: Chocolate Coconut Fudge Jar - Dr Libby
instructions: In food processor blend coconut until creamy and smooth
Add vanilla, maple syrup, cocoa powder, salt and blend until well combined

name: Whiskey Sour
instructions: Mix, shake and and drink

name: Margarita
instructions: Mix together and shake with ice

name: Artist Special Park Hyatt NYC
instructions: mix together with ice, serve in martini glass
comments: Park Hyatt NYC - The Living Room bar across from Carnegie Hall

name: Chris's Mojito
instructions: Combine lime juice, sugar, and mint leaves in glass
Add crushed ice about 3/4 way up
Churn vigorously  with a bar spoon
Add rum and churn again
Top with soda water and more ice as desired

name: Sticky Toffee Gingerbread Pudding
instructions: Combine DATES, WATER, ESPRESSO and COCOA POWDER in saucepan, bring to boil then reduce and simmer for 5 minutes
Whisk FLOUR, BAKING POWDER, SALT, GINGER, CINNAMON, CLOVES, NUTMEG.
Beat BUTTER in a mixer, add MOLASSES and then CREAM, EGG and beat for 2 minutes. Add FLOUR mixture and then add DATE mixture.
Put batter into 8x2 round cake pan and bake at 325F for about 25 minutes until top is lightly cracked. Make the syrup from the caramel syrup recipe.
Poke holes in the hot cake and pour about half of the caramel over the cake. Let rest about 30 min still in the pan.
Flip cake out of pan onto serving platter, poke holes again and pour over remaining caramel. Let it sit 10 minutes before serving.
creator: Gingerbread Recipe book

name: Pasta No Egg
instructions: Mix flour and salt and make a well and pour hot water in center until the dough comes together, about 1 cup. Knead for 5 to 10 minutes until smooth and quite hard
Shape into preferred style and then boil for about 6 minutes
comments: From cooking class in NYC March 2022. Was for cavatelli but could be other noodle types
creator: Rustico cooking class

name: Simple Caramel Syrup
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a small saucepan
Cook over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until everything is melted
Simmer for about 6 minutes or until the syrup is slightly reduced and thickened to a loose honey consistency
comments: super easy and one of the best caramel sauces

name: Apricot Jam Sauce
instructions: Sautee green onion in a little bit of oil
Add jam, stock and water, stir and simmer for 5 to 7 min until thickened

name: Cranberry Pisco Sour

ingredients.ingName: Simple Syrup No Sugar CRANBERRY JUICE

instructions: Make simple syrup by bringing Sugar and Cranberry Juice to a simmer and then turn off heat
Add fresh cranberries to Syrup, allow cool, and ideally wait at least 24hrs
Roll cranberries in fine sugar and leave out at least 1 hr to dry
Mix all ingredients, shake vigorously for 15-20 seconds. Then add ice, shake again and strain into glass
comments: one of our absolute favorite, definitely do the egg white
creator: Alan

name: Dr. Libby's Jam Drops
instructions: Preheat oven to 340F/170c and mix dry ingredients together
Mix wet ingredients together and then combine with dry ingredients
Roll tablespoons of dough into balls. Make hole in the middle with thumb and put about 1/2 tbsp of jam into each drop
Bake 15-20 min or until golden brown
description: Libby's take on classic NZ cookie and very tasty
comments: I usually replace the rice flour with regular bread flour
creator: Dr. Libby

name: Old-Time Gingersnaps
instructions: Whisk all dry ingredients together
Combine butter, sugar and molasses in bowl and stir. Add egg and stir and then add dry ingredients and combine.
Cover bowl and refrigerate at least 2 hrs or overnight
Shape dough into walnut sized balls, roll in sugar and place 2 inches apart.
Base on 350 for between 10-12 minutes until the cookies have spread, are light golden brown, and the cracks still appear moist
comments: everyone loves these cookies and simple to make
creator: Alan

name: Chocolate-Ginger Crinkle Cookies
instructions: Combine butter and half the chocolate, melt over a double boiler. Remove from heat for 10 minutes.
Add both sugars into the chocolate. Then add an egg at a time. Then add vanilla and the flour. Then add the remaining chocolate chips and ginger. Cover dough and refrigerate for 2 to 24 hours
Shape dough into walnut size balls, roll in powdered sugar, and arrange 2 inches apart.
Bake at 350F for 10 to 12 minutes
comments: the spices can be removed and either replaced with mint flavor or even peanut butter cups
creator: Alan

name: French Macarons

ingredients.unit: choice of buttercream or frosting or caramel

instructions: Separate egg whites, cover with plastic wrap and poke holes, refrigerate 24 hours and then bring to room temperate
Whisk egg whites and cream of tartar. Once you have volume add fine sugar in lots of three with whisking in between. Whisk until you have STIFF GLOSSY PEAKS
Add food coloring by folding into the mixture.
Sift almond flour and powdered sugar in glass or metal bowel. Sift multiple times if needed.
Fold egg mixture into the flour mixture in lots of 3 until consistency of honey

Use a piping bag to pipe out the batter onto baking sheets with baking paper. Bang the pan a few times to get out air bubbles and then let rest for 30 - 60 minutes before baking. After they cool on the baking sheet remove and add filling of choice.
Bake batter for 13 minutes in 325F
creator: Sally

name: Butter Icing Edmonds
instructions: Cream butter until light and fluffy and then add vanilla or other flavoring
Beat powder sugar into butter until smooth and then cocoa powder if you want chocolate
Add hot water slowly until it reaches optimal consistency
comments: this is the best for light and fluffy
creator: Edmonds

name: Squash salad dressing from Ashley
instructions: Mix all ingredients together, shake and top your salad
description: Nice dressing Ashley used in recipe for table 10
creator: Ashley

name: Cooked Cinnamon Apples
instructions: Core, peel and cut apples into slices
Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat, add Apples, sprinkle with brown sugar and cinnamon. Cook for 4 or 5 minutes until softened and coated.
description: Stewed apples great in pancakes, as topping, or in baked goods
creator: Marley & Spoon
